name: St. Melania the Elder
summary: Melania the Elder was a Roman noblewoman who became a prominent figure in early monasticism. After the death of her husband and children, she traveled to the Holy Land and founded a monastery on the Mount of Olives. She was a friend and patron of Rufinus of Aquileia and other Church Fathers. She is the grandmother of Melania the Younger and is venerated as a saint.
